title: Critique of Reasoning About Origin of Anxiety

content.question: Leonard’s therapist suggests that Leonard’s anxiety may be the result of an unconscious fear of his father’s disapproval. What might a critic say about the therapist’s suggestion in terms of treating Leonard’s anxiety?

choices.label: The psychodynamic approach is difficult to support because unconscious drives are not falsifiable.
The cognitive approach is insufficient because it does not focus enough on irrational thoughts.
The psychodynamic approach may not be successful because the behavior is too far removed from the reinforcer.
The psychodynamic approach will be less effective than other treatments because it does not focus enough on root causes.

content.answer: The psychodynamic approach is difficult to support because unconscious drives are not falsifiable.
